list_definition.definition: (of ice, snow etc) to melt, or make or become liquid
(of frozen food etc) to make or become unfrozen

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Frozen food must be thawed before cooking.

list_definition.definition: (the time of) the melting of ice and snow at the end of winter, or the change of weather that causes this

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The thaw has come early this year.

list_ex_of_english: Once ice thaws, continued radiation effects can cause mixing of the fuel with meltwater.

On thawing cells don't regain their original shape and turgidity.

The column was subjected to several cycles of top-down freezing and thawing to simulate an active layer.

Survival was evaluated 24 hours after the beginning of thawing.
Measurements were taken at time intervals after thawing to determine when the bacteria regained photosynthetic activity.
